free_text.Learning outcomes: [li] To provide a comprehensive overview of present day's techniques and methods to realize microoptical and optical MEMS structures.[br/][li] To provide an in depth understanding of optics on the micrometer and nanometer scale, where diffraction and refraction effects strongly overlap.[br/][li] To discuss complete microfabrication processes for the realization of glass and silicon microoptical systems.[br/][li] To present examples of modern industrial applications of microoptical systems.
free_text.Content: 1. Microoptics[br/][br/]a) Propagation of light (Fourier optics)[br/]b) Diffractive optics and holograms[br/]c) Examples: (microlenses, diffractive optical elements (DOEs), micromirrors)[br/]d) Simulation of optics: matrix method, ABCD law, and Optical CAD[br/]e) Effects of real microoptical elements in an optical path (diffraction, aberrations, fill factor)[br/]f) Coupling efficiency between optical fibers and between optical fibers and collimated/focused beams[br/]g) Microfabrication of optical microstructures  (microlenses and DOEs)[br/]h) Limits of miniaturization[br/]i) Moving towards the nanoscale [br/][br/]2. Optical MEMS (MOEMS)[br/][br/]a) Bulk- and Surface-Micromachining[br/]b) Actuators[br/]c) Micromirrors (vertical and horizontal)[br/]d) Microfabrication of MOEMS[br/]e) Limits of microfabrication for MOEMS[br/]f) Examples of MOEMS Devices and applications[br/]g) Mechanical and optical simulations of MOEMS[br/]h) Measurements and Performance of MOEMS[br/]i) Important properties/characteristics: insertion loss, PDL, switching time, etc.
free_text.Keywords: [br/]Microoptics, Microfabrication, Optical MEMS, Micromirrors, optical simulations
free_text.Note: Building:[br/]IMT-NE / SAMLAB and CSEM Building - Rue Jaquet Droz 1 - 2000 Neuchatel[br/]
free_text.Required prior knowledge: [li] Introductory course to optics and microfabrication technologies[br/][li] Basics of chemistry and physics
